title: Retro Toy Commercials
description: Remember those unforgettable toy commercials between your favorite shows? Test your knowledge of the ads that made every kid's wish list!

questions.question: What was the first toy ever advertised on television in 1952?
The Slinky commercial featured what unforgettable jingle?
options: Slinky, Slinky, it's so much fun
It's Slinky, it's Slinky, for fun it's a wonderful toy

questions.question: What time of year were toy commercials most heavily aired on television?
The famous Lite-Brite commercial featured children singing what catchy jingle?
What show-within-a-show format did the Mattel toy company pioneer for advertising toys to children?
options: Sponsoring entire children's TV shows built around their toys

questions.question: The Play-Doh jingle included what memorable phrase?
options: Fun to play with, not to eat

questions.question: Saturday morning cartoons were prime advertising time for toy companies. What decade is considered the golden age of Saturday morning cartoons?
What Hot Wheels commercial technique made the toy cars look incredibly fast and exciting?
options: Filming at ground level with close-up camera angles

questions.question: The Chia Pet commercials, which became iconic in the 1980s, featured what memorable jingle?
What phrase did toy commercials famously include in small print or quick voiceover to manage expectations?
The famous 'My Buddy' and 'Kid Sister' doll commercials from the 1980s were made by which company?
What annual publication was essentially a printed version of toy commercials that children pored over?
The G.I. Joe cartoon and toy commercials always ended with what educational segment?
options: A 'Knowing is half the battle' public service announcement

questions.question: In the 1970s, the FTC began regulating children's toy advertising. What was one major rule introduced?
options: Toys could only be advertised after 9 PM
Only parents could appear in commercials
Commercials had to show the toy's actual size
Toy prices had to be displayed

questions.question: What was the most common way children told their parents about toys they wanted after seeing a commercial?
options: Circling items in the Christmas catalog
